intro: Hamelia viridifolia, commonly known as greenleaf flamebush, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are typically a vibrant green. It produces clusters of bright orange-red flowers that bloom in the summer months. Hamelia viridifolia is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking foliage and showy blooms.
